title: Prius - Never Ending Question Game
description: As a part of our software engineering course, DD1365, we were presented with a bunch of different project cases from different companies. Our team chose Findwise. They had a project revolving around adapting the game 'När Då Då' to a mobile game with a big focus on crawling the web for questions. The end result was a question-based game which crawled wikipedia to produce the games' questions.
reflection: Developing an android app was a great experience. Another great aspect of the project was the practice I got adapting a well known game into a mobile adaptation trying to reuse cues to make players who had played 'När Då Då' feel right at home in the app.
process: The course relied heavily on the waterfall method which meant producing a lot of documents ahead of time. This approach to a project was very bureaucratic and felt overly complicated for a project of this size. We tried merging it with a somewhat agile approach to some success.
information: I was in charge of design and helped with the front end and android development for the project. The group was split up into 3 groups of 3. One management group, one crawler/back end group and one android/front end group. I was a part of the latter.
